reviews.text: I stayed here for a few nights because of the location and other St. Kilda hostels were booked. The good points- the staff was super friendly, and that makes a huge difference to me. Any experience at a hostel will also be determined by the people you are sharing it with, and I had some good rommates so we did have some fun.It's located directly over a pub with $6 backpacker meals!!! I foudn the food to be quite good The not so good- there are many long-term people who have lived there for years and treat the entire floor as their own personal garbage can. the cleaners did their job in the mornings and by afternoon, there was food everywhere and by evening the uncovered trash cans were stinking up the living area. It's a problem that could be fixed with a manager enforcing the clean-up-after-yourself rules but that doesnt seem to happen. The kitchen is tiny and awkwardly set up. I think they want to encourage you to go into the pub. So all in all, it wasn't a bad stay, but it was quite messy.
reviews.title: Not horrible, but not good either

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: came in for a week, and wanted to stay sober, that is unusual for this place.
reviews.title: get out quickly

reviews.text: No one is awake during the day, and they sell you steep grog at ridiculous prices and put salt and fat all over your food so that you need to drink some more
reviews.title: Had a great time

reviews.text: if you want to sleep, forget it, find a park bench
reviews.title: I CANNOT SAY THIS ENOUGH - DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! You will regret it if you do.

reviews.text: went to another hostel around the corner and found better value and got some sleep there and washed off the bed bugs that took me to hospital from pint on punt
reviews.title: Not great, not awful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Pint on Punt for 6 nights in july 2010.
reviews.title: Even though it's cheap, this hostel is still a rip-off.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the good side, the staff were really friendly and helpful, definetely the highlight of the Hostel. The location also wasn't bad, you had to catch a tram to go anywhere other than St Kilda, but there were tons of trams within walking distance, so no problem. Also, below the hostel was a nice, lively, cosy pub were you could down a good pint or two.
reviews.title: Looking for a good hostel in St. Kilda, then keep looking, this aint it!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The double room we rented for about 60 dollars a day was a total rip off, though. It was old, dirty, hadn't been properly clean in ages, there was dust all over the carpet and parts of the bed, the tiny, ancient sink was almost clogged, you couldn't leave the water running for more than a minute without filling it up, the bathrooms sometimes lacked toilet paper and the windows in one were broken so they let in all the nice melbourne winter cold, only one of the showers worked properly, the others constantly alternated between icy cold and burning hot water, there was no soap anywhere to be seen and it also seems like the toilets hadn't been cleaned in a month. The sleep quality also wasn't the best, since people that worked were living there and made a total ruckus in the morning.
reviews.title: dirty, horrible and disgusting place

reviews.text: The owners of Pint on Punt should be ashamed of themselves for ripping off their customers in such a way - we didn't expect any luxuty at all, but at least a clean hostel with working plumbing and windows to keep in the warmth. The only way to sleep there properly would be to get totally hammered in the pub every night, which they invite you to do - that's be great, if the purpose wasn't also to make you forget the crappy place you're staying at. It'll probably be more tolerable in the Summer, when you don't need windows, though.
reviews.title: a vibrant hostel

reviews.text: This hostel has a good location right on St. Kilda junction giving you easy access to the tram network. Its located above an irish pub which is not cheap for drink by any means. The $6 meals are cheap, but you'll be eating deep fried food everyday.
reviews.title: Ecellent value, location, food and fun!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic little hostel this one, Local to St Kilda beach.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my fiance had a great time staying here, the staff were friendly and above all its above a pub....which gives you cheap drinks and food.....what more can be said?
reviews.title: Horrible hostel do not stay here!....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Go there if you're in Melbourne
reviews.title: Friendly, Fun, Great location!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Right where do I start, me and my girlfriend booked 4 nights in advance here/(big mistake) as wed been staying in the city and wanted the weekend in st kilda....wished wed just stayed in the city!
reviews.title: Things that go creep in the night!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First thing the room is average, we booked a twin and the bed etc are fine a little lumpy but then its a hostel after all.
reviews.title: Ok place but noisy

reviews.text: WORST PLACE I'VE STAYED!! They have 24 hour check-in but that is the only good thing I can say about this place. After what felt like a long flight me and my friend arrived at about 1am. We were shown to our room (6 bed female dorm when we asked for a 4), the door wasn't locked (didn't even shut!!) and thank god the lights were off because if we had actually seen the state of the room we would have walked straight back out. The room was in such a mess you couldn't see the floor with stale food on the shelf (but that wasn't just in our room). The shower's didn't work (you either got scalded or froze), toilet doors didn't lock and the 'kitchen' was a joke as it consisted of a dirty sink and an old & stained microwave . It is above a pub but the noise was louder than I expected and I didn't expect to hear the noise continue throughout the night, especially as we were on the 2nd floor!! We were booked in for two nights but could only manage one. DON'T STAY THERE!!!
reviews.title: Never again!!!!

reviews.text: DIRTY, FILTHY AND UNSAFE!!! My friend and i booked in here for two nights but only stomached the one and that was too long. the bedroom doors dont lock (or close fullstop), the showers dont work, the toilets dont lock, the 'kitchen' consisted of a grimy sink and a, stained beyond belief, microwave. Although its above a pub i didnt expect the level of noise, drunken fights and constant sound of people vomiting! first impression wasnt the best as we were greeted by a group of male patronts falling out of the pub swearing and shouting and the noise continued throughout the night. the bedrooms were in a no better state. the bedlinen was questionable and our room was so messy you couldnt see the floor and there was week old food left all over the place (although that wasnt just confined to our room). all in all the worst place i have ever had the misfortune of staying! I wouldnt wish it on an enemy!!! DONT GO!
reviews.title: Most disgusting place ever!!
